document_data.mainbody:
Tiernons sundered shield was an enchanted shield found in the black peaks of Gloomfrost and restored by a blind duergar smith Tiernon Denthelm in 1281 DR.
When the shield was found, it had a huge dent from a frost giants fist. It bore the makers mark of Tiernon and was decorated with an image of a dented helm. However, it was hard to tell if the image was dented by design or by the giants punch that bent the shield.
After being restored, the shield faintly glowed and vibrated with power as if humming to itself.
When restored to its full power, Tiernons sundered shield had a +3 enchantment and granted its wielder partial resistance to physical harm. Additionally, the wielder could further increase ones resistance to physical attacks for ten minutes once per day and tap into the shields magic to remove their fatigue.
Originally created by Tiernon Denthelm, the shield was smashed and its enchantments damaged in battle with a giant in the icy peak of Gloomfrost. In 1281 DR, the shield was brought to Tiernon to be restored. The smith "awoken" enchantments within its damaged shell by retracing runes that permeated its edges and re-created the Denthelm insignia.
